episode_summary: This Valentine's Day special episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features facts about dolphins practicing flirting, a near-death hypothermia recovery leading to romance, ancient Mesopotamian expressions of love, and Australian Aboriginal marriage customs involving mother-in-law avoidance.

facts.fact: Before flirting with females, young male dolphins practice on their male friends.
The adult who's come closest to freezing to death and being brought back to life got together with the person who resuscitated her.
If ancient Mesopotamia had Valentine's cards, they would probably contain pictures of knees.
Once married, some Australian Aboriginals spend the rest of their lives actively avoiding their mother-in-law.
